page.title: 02BRUSH ENGINEERING COMPANIES
page.content: {The Brush Engineering Complex}includes 3 separate companies:{Brush Electrical {Machines, Brush Switchgear}and{Brush {Transformers.}They cover 80 acres and are now owned by{Hawker Siddeley.} B.E.M.is the largest, employing 2,200 people and has three divisions: { Rotating Machines}make motors, generators and dynamos.Some are huge weighing up to 350 tons. The metal has to be cut, shaped, welded, machined, assembled, tested and dispatched. {Traction}make diesel and electric locomotives for London Underground and British Rail as well as for overseas. {Control Gear}make the electronic and computer controls for the machines produced.70% of their work is for overseas.{Switchgear}employ 800 and { {Transformers}550. The total turnover is over Â£100 million a year. The men work on piece work for a 39 hr.week.
